catalog_info.title: The True and the Good
catalog_info.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Culture and Belief.
catalog_info.description: The course introduces students to philosophical argumentation and writing. It is organized around a range of central philosophical questions, concerning the nature of right and wrong, free will and responsibility, the relation between self, mind, and nature, and god and death. We'll pay particular attention to how answers to one question interact with answers to the others. No previous experience with philosophy is required.Note: This course, when taken for letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Culture and Belief.
